story.text: Jan 3 CECO Environmental Corp. (CECE.O) said it has secured two orders valued at over $55 million in two automotive facilities. The provider of air pollution control and industrial ventilation systems said one order is for an automotive facility in the southeast, and the second for a facility in the midwest. The projects will be executed by its subsidiaries H.M. White and Kirk & Blum, the company added in a news release. Chairman and CEO Phillip DeZwirek said in the statement that the company ended 2006 with a back-log of about $100 million, up 245 percent year over year. Shares of the company were up 10.37 percent at $9.90 in late morning Nasdaq trade. (Reporting by Hezron Selvi in Bangalore)
story.title: ceco environmental receives two orders topping $ 55 mln
